intro: Saccolabium dives, commonly known as the blue mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its showy, blue to violet flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has lance-shaped leaves with a silvery underside, giving it a distinctive appearance. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it suitable for xeriscaping. Saccolabium dives is also known for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
